When a customer-facing bug is filed in Zendesk, someone on our CS team has to manually create a corresponding ticket in Jira, copy over all the context, attach the screenshots, and tag the right engineering team.
So when engineering fixes the bug, CS has no idea unless someone remembers to go back and update the Zendesk ticket.

My finance team has flagged it as an audit risk because we can't reconcile what we're paying for.
If any one of those steps fails, everything downstream is broken.

feature_requests: Esto es un pain point importante — P-060 needs real-time collaboration on billing history in payment section. Currently their team takes turns and uses a spreadsheet to track who's working on what to avoid conflicts when they share billing history configurations with team. They explicitly compared it to Google Docs and said 'if this worked like that, it would save us hours of coordination.' Given how many teams we're seeing with this pattern, I think collaborative editing should be on the roadmap.

The participant asked if we have an API for invoice download because they want to automate the share invoice download configurations with team process in billing page. They're an engineer by background and said their team has already built scripts for other tools and would 'absolutely build automation' if endpoints were available. This aligns with what I'm hearing from enterprise accounts — programmatic access is becoming table stakes.
realtime collab on billing history needed @laura

pain_points: - Issue: batch import performance degrades significantly with large datasets in import wizard - Severity: Medium-High — blocks power users - Frequency: Daily for teams with 10k+ records - User Impact: Users resort to manual export and external processing to load batch import results at scale - Suggested Fix: Optimize batch import query performance and add progress indicators
error msgs in data ingestion area unhelpful - 'something went wrong' - that's it - P-017 filed support ticket - hidden file limit on format conversion - critical fix needed
Participant: The error messages are almost useless.
I'll get something like kind of 'Row 847: validation right error' um with no detail about sort of which field or basically what the error is.

Last time I had 200 rows with yeah errors and the only way to find right the problems was to open the original like CSV, go to row 847 and actually manually basically check each field actually against the system's validation honestly rules Which aren't documented like anywhere by the way I eventually figured out that row 847 had like a zip code sort of with a leading zero that got sort of stripped right by Excel But discovering that took uh me kind of forty-five minutes per error type Interviewer: Tell me about handling files that have merged cells or inconsistent row I mean formatting Participant: Our actually finance team sends me these Excel files where actually they've merged cells across rows for grouping purposes The like upload parser honestly treats merged cells as one record with blank fields for the rows below.
[00:11:44] Participant: The error messages are almost useless.
I'll get something like 'Row 847: validation error' with no detail about which field or what the error is.
But discovering that took me forty-five minutes per error type.
